item.description:
Mount Major near West Alton, NH is a rocky summit with extensive views of Lake Winnipesaukee and the Belknap Range, and even the White Mountains in clear weather.

It will still be winter in the mountains. We will post gear recommendations the week before the hike.


This is a loop hike up to Mount Major.

* From the back, left-hand corner of the parking lot, get onto the snowmobile trail which quickly crosses a wooden bridge.
* After about 0.4 mile on the snowmobile trail, turn right onto Boulder Loop which starts to climb.
* Boulder Loop climbs easily at first then gets steeper as it winds amongst ledge and boulders. After a final steep pitch, you will reach semi-open ledges (where the trail curves to the left) with views and much easier inclines.
* After 1.4 miles on Boulder Loop, you will reach the summit of Mount Major.
* Descend by walking away from the view (in a westerly direction) to get onto Brook Trail.
* Follow Brook Trail, keeping to the right as you pass two trail junctions on the upper part of the mountain.
* Brook Trail will flow straight into Mount Major Trail/Main Trail which will return you to the parking lot, 2.4 miles from the summit.




Trailhead: Parking lot is on the left hand side or Route 11 just 4.2 miles north of the town of Alton Bay. There is a sign on route 11.

Trailhead is on the back right side of the parking lot if you are facing the mountain.

We can find a place to get a sandwich after the hike.
item.name: MT MAJOR ALTON BAY, NH
